--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Robert Martin <UncleBob@...> wrote:
>
> I've =
struggled with this myself.  Agitar has some very cool  
> capabilities, bu=
t I can't figure out when I'd actually use them.
> ... I don't really know =
when I'd use the agitation.
> 

I suspect that's because you see the tool a=
 test generator.  It isn't.

When I work with people I try and teach them h=
ow to use agitation as
an exploratory tool to drive improvements in their c=
ode. Most of the
improvements fall into one of two categories:

  1. standa=
rd refactorings like extract method or introducing
dependency injection,
  =
2. changes to more completely express their domain model, such as
introduci=
ng a constraint or a new type

In a given agitation mentoring session that'=
s how we'll spend the bulk
of the time and at the end of it the code is (ho=
pefully) improved.

Oh yes, and we'll also create tests and probably fix so=
me bugs, but
most of the time is spent thinking and talking about design.

=
Jtf
